comment.author: 52682399@N07
comment._content:
The Dizzy Gillespie Orchestra played at the Downbeat Club July 18–August 28, 1947.
(New York Amsterdam News, July 19, 1947, 19: ad. “Goings on About Town,” New Yorker August 30, 1947).
Miles Davis' presence is mysterious. He was never a regular member of this band. Normally the band had 4 trumpets (not counting Dizzy),  here we see 5. Is Miles Davis rehearsing for a subbing job in the band?
